intro: Eriocaulon yba, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and flowering structures. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and colonize wetland areas effectively. Eriocaulon yba plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
